multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: commodities; the Power of Siberia 2 pipeline will increase Russian gas supply to China, likely dampening European gas prices and shifting global energy flows, with downstream effects on energy markets and related yields.

category.motivation: The article reports Gazprom signing a legally binding agreement to build the Power of Siberia 2 pipeline to China, which is a company-level action not related to earnings.

impact.motivation: The new Power of Siberia 2 pipeline could increase gas supply to China, potentially easing pressure on global natgas prices and influencing energy markets, though pricing details are still pending.

time_frame.motivation: The article discusses long-term structural drivers relevant to this node.

article_node.title: Xi, Putin Tighten Ties in Beijing With Apparent Gas Breakthrough
article_node.summary: Russia’s Gazprom has signed a legally binding agreement to build the Power of Siberia 2 pipeline to China via Mongolia, potentially delivering up to 50 billion cubic metres per year for 30 years. The deal marks a diplomatic win for Putin amid Western sanctions and signals deeper Russia‑China energy cooperation. Xi and Putin celebrated the agreement during a Beijing meeting, underscoring high‑level ties. China has yet to confirm details or set pricing, but expects rates lower than current European contracts.
